title: Does Samsung have an army? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you mean 'Army' as in having their own private military force much like the East India Company during the years of the British Empire, then no. None of the conglomerates in South Korea have their own armies. They would be ripped apart for it. It's military department know as Hanwha Techwin founded as Samsung Techwin But rumours are that Samsung Forming an Army in Barcelona. But who knows they may have a Army.

Armies serve two main purposes. To shoot people and to protect things. Who would Samsung want to kill? Apple users? Apple buys stuff from Samsung. Samsung does not have a monopoly so any over the top behaviour will strengthen its competitors. As for protection, Samsung does not build it's factories in warzones. It gets by with the laws of whatever country it works with. Lastly, there are security companies that offer discreet services if needed. There is no need to arm your employees.
